definition: Picornaviridae (virus family including many human pathogens)/small RNA virus

sentences.english: I was a little sick on the road trip too but I had some soup and felt a lot better.
sentences.chinese: 打客场时我生了点小病，后来喝了点汤，就舒服多了。

sentences.english: He hospitalizes patients for minor ailments.
sentences.chinese: 只有小病的患者也送进医院。

sentences.english: Now I have come to understand the real meaning of “a small ailment is a blessing”.
sentences.chinese: 现在我终于明白了“小病是福”的真正含义。

sentences.english: That really broke my rhythm and I got a little sick later.
sentences.chinese: 那真的打破了我的节奏，之后我就生了一场小病。

sentences.english: Financial constraints cause many to skip antenatal care or postpone treatment for minor ailments.
sentences.chinese: 经济制约使许多人不去接受产前保健或延缓治疗小病。

sentences.english: For the majority of people, swine flu is a minor illness.
sentences.chinese: 对大多数人来说，猪流感是小病。

sentences.english: The palette reaches from the most harmless indisposition up to the most serious diseases.
sentences.chinese: 从最无害的小病到最严重疾病。

sentences.english: John has just recovered from his indisposition.
He hospitalizes patients for minor ailments.
sentences.chinese: 他把只有小病的患者也送进医院。

sentences.english: His mother had to change her approach to minor illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 母亲需要改变对孩子小毛小病的处理方法。

sentences.english: Build a sweat, ailment without looking at.
sentences.chinese: 练出一身汗，小病不用看。

definition: hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to fall ill/to contract a disease
to visit a doctor/to see a patient
